text: At Perennial in May 2015. Ridiculously jammy with a pleasant acidity. Some earth and raspberry seed. Fantastic.

bottle shared at our tasting. split 4-ways. poured a bright red to pink colour with a light pink coloured head on top. the nose explodes in a split second with sweet raspberry tartness, just tons of fruited raspberries, still so fresh, this is on a complete different level compared to the abricot version, so much cleaner, and not as tart sour as side project brews can get. still lots of clean funk on the back of the nose, tart apples, some citrus, clean oak, not getting to vinous, sweet raspberry yoghurt, light grains, and funky yeast. the flavor has even more sweet raspberries upfront, incredible balance of sweet and sour notes. slight horseblanket funk. an aboslute incredible side project brew, and maybe the best one cory has ever made. this is so balanced without getting to sour.

750ml bottle pours out a hazy red topped with a small head. nose is great big raspberry jam strawberries and a big tartness. taste is more of the heavy jam raspberries strawberries and a nice tartness.

Bottle shared by Brandon, thanks man! Pour is hazy pink/ purple with a large pink head. Aroma is really funky with loads of berry. Flavor is Super tart up front with Lots of berry to follow. Finish with tart and funky with lingering berry.
UPDATED: JAN 6, 2016 Bottle - - pours purple pink head - nose and taste of raspberry, tart acidic acid, red wine, oak and vinegar funk - medium body
750 ml. shared bottle. Pours a nice dark red with a small pink head. Aroma of raspberries, funk, and wood. Taste is raspberries, funk, citrus, and oak. Superb.
Bottle. Garnet pour with a white head. Big raspberry bouquet. Tasty with loads of raspberry highlights. Nice caramel malt and oak backbeats. Good body and mouthfeel.

750 mL bottle poured into a snifter. Deep pink/purple body. Hazy. Small white head. Raspberry and white wine. Almost all raspberry. Some yeast that reminds you its a saison. Sharp sourness. Sour raspberry. Some raspberry sweetness. A little bit musty. White wine finish. Medium light. A bit too sour for me. The raspberry flavor is good, but it dominates everything. Missing some of the quality of the base beer.
Bottle - Pours a weird browish/red. Nose is lots of raspberries, sour, funky, oak, poopy. Taste is sour raspberries, lemons, barnyard funk. This is damn good.

This beer is absolute perfection. Pours a beautiful ruby red color with a light pink head. Aroma is massive raspberries, tart, dry, funk. Flavor is potently sour, like a raspberry warhead, coating the pallet with sour oily goodness. Wow. Thanks JP for sharing!

Draft at Hill Farmstead with a bunch of heads. Pours a vibrant pinkish red shade with medium to large white head. Aroma is the standout here with ultra sour raspberry, bright French oak, and super tart yeasts. Flavor wasnt as impressive for me. A little thin and a touch too acidic with notes of raspberry puree, red wine, and cranberry. Very nice but I much preferred the regular fermier at this FOFA.

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2015 Bottle poured at FOFA15 with Linh, Paul, Vin and Alan. Pours a beautiful glowing pink body with rich haze and white lacing. Aroma is super in your face - raspberries all the way - pretty incredible. Mouthfeel is very acidic with notes of super sour fruits - cranberries, raspberries and some strawberries with lots of tart acid, raspberry candies and pure sour oak character. Unrelenting sourness. Great, hard to believe the regular saison version untreated with raspberries was better.
Wow. Deep red color, pink head. Raspberry explosion. The fruit flavor is so vibrant. Perfect amount of sourness, perfect carbonation. Perfectly barreled.

yup, Bottle thanks to Dustin, this is the shit, tons of raspberry flavors, without the sweetness, or tartness really. the tart/sweet comes from teh base beer which is subtle lactic, very light brett, and white light grains (Wheat). Awesome beer right here.

Bottle thanks to Dustin. Pours a cloudy ruby with medium frothy pinkish head that lasts. The aroma is strong raspberry, oak, funk. Medium mouth, jammy, tart raspberry, light funk, oak, really enjoyed this one.
From the bottle. Raspberry...raspberry...raspberry...dark red pour with a light reddish white head. Aroma and flavor of tasty raspberry tart and awesomeness. Love this beer!
750 B1. Huge thanks to Matt for opening this one. Incredible raspberry nose. Amazing. Taste is mildly sour for a SP, raspberry and lemon. Very balanced. No harsh acidity. Truly amazing stuff.
